contentrichtext.text: {{italictitle}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Xenocytaea triramosa'' | image = | image_width = 240px | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Arthropoda]] | classis = [[Arachnida]] | ordo = [[Araneae]] | familia = [[Salticidae]] | genus = ''[[Xenocytaea]]'' | species = '''''X. triramosa''''' | binomial = ''Xenocytaea triramosa'' | binomial_authority = Berry, Beatty & Prószyński, 1998 }} '''''Xenocytaea triramosa''''' is a [[jumping spider]]. ==Name== The [[epitheton]] ''triramosa'' refers to the three-part [[retrolateral tibial apophysis]] (RTA) of the male palp. ==Appearance== ''X. triramosa'' males are about 4mm long, with females up to 5.5mm. ==Distribution== ''X. triramosa'' is only known from [[Viti Levu]], [[Fiji]]. ==References== * Berry, J.W., Beatty, J.A. & Proszynski, J. (1998). Salticidae of the Pacific Islands. III. Distribution of Seven Genera, with Description of Nineteen New Species and Two New Genera. ''Journal of Arachnology'' 26(2):149-189. [http://www.americanarachnology.org/JoA_free/JoA_v26_n2/JoA_v26_p149.pdf PDF] [[Category:Salticidae]] {{Salticidae-stub}}
